neighbors.name: Jeffrey Boyce
neighbors.claims: Jeffrey Boyce is a recorded landowner in the Town of Elba, Genesee County, owning Parcel 16.-1-1.112 ([geneseeny.gov](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/sharedassets/county/v/1/treasurer/assessment-rolls/elba-2025-tentative-roll.pdf)). He has been identified professionally as the Director of Research-Supported Economic Development for the SUNY Research Foundation ([suny.edu](http://www.suny.edu/media/suny/content-assets/documents/research/START-UP_NY-SUNY-ProgressReport-2017.pdf)). No local meeting minutes or news reports show Boyce voicing any opinion on recent development proposals ([thebatavian.com](https://www.thebatavian.com/tags/town-of-alabama)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Holds director-level position at major state research foundation

approach_recommendations.engage: Acknowledge his professional background in economic development. Approach as a knowledgeable stakeholder who likely understands land use economics but may prioritize personal residential amenity.

citations.claim: Jeffrey Boyce is a recorded landowner in the Town of Elba, Genesee County, owning Parcel 16.-1-1.112
citations.title: Town of Elba 2025 Tentative Assessment Roll

citations.claim: He has been identified professionally as the Director of Research-Supported Economic Development for the SUNY Research Foundation
citations.title: START-UP NY 2017 Progress Report

citations.claim: No local meeting minutes or news reports show Boyce voicing any opinion on recent development proposals
citations.title: The Batavian - Town of Alabama Search

neighbors.name: Brice Johnson
neighbors.claims: Brice Johnson owns agricultural land (Parcel 16.-1-2.1) in the Town of Elba, Genesee County ([geneseeny.gov](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/1/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)). He is a confirmed participant in renewable energy development, having signed a Lease Agreement with Hecate Energy Cider Solar LLC in January 2023 ([dps.ny.gov](https://documents.dps.ny.gov/public/Common/ViewDoc.aspx?DocRefId={C04B4D91-0000-C72D-923C-C58FC173D7D1}&DocTitle=AttB_CSF_LandAgreementSummary)). Johnson is the son of the late Esther Johnson, a long-time local resident and church volunteer ([bataviafuneralhomes.com](https://www.bataviafuneralhomes.com/obituaries/esther-johnson-22)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Maintain relationship as a participating leaseholder. Ensure he is satisfied with construction/operation protocols and feels his contract terms are being honored.

citations.claim: Brice Johnson owns agricultural land (Parcel 16.-1-2.1) in the Town of Elba, Genesee County
citations.title: Genesee County Agricultural District Review 2025

citations.claim: He is a confirmed participant in renewable energy development, having signed a Lease Agreement with Hecate Energy Cider Solar LLC in January 2023
citations.title: Cider Solar Farm Land Agreement Summary

citations.claim: Johnson is the son of the late Esther Johnson, a long-time local resident and church volunteer
citations.title: Obituary for Esther Johnson

neighbors.name: Ellen Hersee
neighbors.claims: Public property records for Genesee County indicate that the parcel 12.-1-9 in the Town of Alabama is owned by Randall P. Hecko and Nancy Ann Hecko, not Ellen Hersee ([geneseeny.gov](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/sharedassets/county/v/1/treasurer/assessment-rolls/final-rolls/alabama-2024-final-roll.pdf)). Ellen Hersee could not be verified as the owner of this specific pin in current assessment rolls. No public records were found linking an individual named Ellen Hersee to development testimony in Genesee County ([thebatavian.com](https://www.thebatavian.com/tags/town-of-alabama)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Could not verify identity match to parcel

approach_recommendations.engage: Verify correct parcel ownership before outreach. The provided pin (12.-1-9) belongs to the Hecko family.

citations.claim: Public property records for Genesee County indicate that the parcel 12.-1-9 in the Town of Alabama is owned by Randall P. Hecko and Nancy Ann Hecko
citations.title: Town of Alabama 2024 Final Assessment Roll

citations.claim: No public records were found linking an individual named Ellen Hersee to development testimony in Genesee County
citations.title: The Batavian - Search Results
